t: Psalm 109
Vengeance Invoked upon Adversaries.
For the choir director. A Psalm of David.
O*pn God of my praise, Do*ln not be silent!
For*ln they have opened the wicked and deceitful mouth against me; They*ln have spoken against me with a lying tongue.
They*ln have also surrounded me with words of hatred, And*ln fought against me without cause.
In*ln return for my love they act as my accusers; But*ln I am in*i prayer.
Thus*ln they have repaid me evil for good And*ln hatred for my love.
Appoint*ln a wicked man over him, And*ln let an accuser stand at his right hand.
When*ln he is judged, let him come forth guilty, And*ln let his prayer become sin.
Let*ln his days be few; Let*ln another take his office.
Let*ln his children be fatherless And*ln his wife a widow.
Let*ln his children wander about and beg; And*ln let them seek sustenance*i far from their ruined homes.
Let*ln the creditor seize all that he has, And*ln let strangers plunder the product of his labor.
Let*ln there be none to extend lovingkindness to him, Nor*ln any to be gracious to his fatherless children.
Let*ln his posterity be cut off; In*ln a following generation let their name be blotted out.
Let*ln the iniquity of his fathers be remembered before the Lord,*s And*ln do not let the sin of his mother be blotted out.
Let*ln them be before the Lord*s continually, That*ln He may cut off their memory from the earth;
Because*ln he did not remember to show lovingkindness, But*ln persecuted the afflicted and needy man, And*ln the despondent in heart, to put them*i to death.
He*ln also loved cursing, so it came to him; And*ln he did not delight in blessing, so it was far from him.
But*ln he clothed himself with cursing as with his garment, And*ln it entered into his body like water And*ln like oil into his bones.
Let*ln it be to him as a garment with which he covers himself, And*ln for a belt with which he constantly girds himself.
Let*ln this be the reward of my accusers from the Lord,*s And*ln of those who speak evil against my soul.
But*ln You, O God,*s the Lord, deal kindly*i with me for Your nameâ€™s sake; Because*ln Your lovingkindness is good, deliver me;
For*ln I am afflicted and needy, And*ln my heart is wounded within me.
I*ln am passing like a shadow when it lengthens; I*ln am shaken off like the locust.
My*ln knees are weak from fasting, And*ln my flesh has grown lean, without fatness.
I*ln also have become a reproach to them; When*ln they see me, they wag their head.
Help*ln me, O Lord*s my God; Save*ln me according to Your lovingkindness.
And*ln let them know that this is Your hand; You,*ln Lord,*s have done it.
Let*ln them curse, but You bless; When*ln they arise, they shall be ashamed, But*ln Your servant shall be glad.
Let*ln my accusers be clothed with dishonor, And*ln let them cover themselves with their own shame as with a robe.
With*ln my mouth I will give thanks abundantly to the Lord;*s And*ln in the midst of many I will praise Him.
For*ln He stands at the right hand of the needy, To*ln save him from those who judge his soul.
